intro: Macvaughiella chiapensis, commonly known as the Chiapas spurge, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Chiapas, Mexico. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a diverse group of plants known for their unique floral structures and sometimes toxic sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered inflorescences that are typical of the genus. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
